com.android.volley.cronet

Class CronetHttpStack.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.android.volley.cronet.CronetHttpStack.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    CronetHttpStack

    public static class CronetHttpStack.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    Builder is used to build an instance of CronetHttpStack from values configured by the setters.

    • Method Detail

      • setCronetEngine

        public CronetHttpStack.Builder setCronetEngine(org.chromium.net.CronetEngine engine)
        Sets the CronetEngine to be used. Defaults to a vanialla CronetEngine.

      • setPool

        public CronetHttpStack.Builder setPool(ByteArrayPool pool)
        Sets the ByteArrayPool to be used. Defaults to a new pool with 4096 bytes.

      • setUrlRewriter

        public CronetHttpStack.Builder setUrlRewriter(UrlRewriter urlRewriter)
        Sets the UrlRewriter to be used. Default is to return the original string.

      • setRequestListener

        public CronetHttpStack.Builder setRequestListener(CronetHttpStack.RequestListener requestListener)
        Set the optional RequestListener to be used.

      • setCurlLoggingEnabled

        public CronetHttpStack.Builder setCurlLoggingEnabled(boolean curlLoggingEnabled)
        Sets whether cURL logging should be enabled for debugging purposes.

        When enabled, for each request dispatched to the network, a roughly-equivalent cURL command will be logged to logcat.

        The command may be missing some headers that are added by Cronet automatically, and the full request body may not be included if it is too large. To inspect the full requests and responses, see CronetEngine#startNetLogToFile.

        WARNING: This is only intended for debugging purposes and should never be enabled on production devices.

        See Also:
        #setCurlCommandLogger(CurlCommandLogger), setLogAuthTokensInCurlCommands(boolean)

      • setCurlCommandLogger

        public CronetHttpStack.Builder setCurlCommandLogger(CronetHttpStack.CurlCommandLogger curlCommandLogger)
        Sets the function used to log cURL commands.

        Allows customization of the logging performed when cURL logging is enabled.

        By default, when cURL logging is enabled, cURL commands are logged using VolleyLog.v(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...), e.g. at the verbose log level with the same log tag used by the rest of Volley. This function may optionally be invoked to provide a custom logger.

        See Also:
        setCurlLoggingEnabled(boolean)

      • setLogAuthTokensInCurlCommands

        public CronetHttpStack.Builder setLogAuthTokensInCurlCommands(boolean logAuthTokensInCurlCommands)
        Sets whether to log known auth tokens in cURL commands, or redact them.

        By default, headers which may contain auth tokens (e.g. Authorization or Cookie) will have their values redacted. Passing true to this method will disable this redaction and log the values of these headers.

        This heuristic is not perfect; tokens that are logged in unknown headers, or in the request body itself, will not be redacted as they cannot be detected generically.

        See Also:
        setCurlLoggingEnabled(boolean)

        public CronetHttpStack build()
